intro: Stellilabium butcheri, commonly known as the Butcher's stellilabium, is a rare flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and high sunlight exposure. Its leaves are generally narrow and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
